name: Breaking Bad Barriers
description:
I have had moderate success with this deck. It is a bit slow at the moment but I believe it has potential. Looking for suggestions and/or feedback.

Starting hand: Ideally you want Wyldside to get to the cards you need. Aesop's is nice early too for economy and to trash cards no longer useful (Armitage, Daily Casts, Wyldside, Deep Red, etc).

Synergy: A lot of this deck revolves around getting E3 Feedback Implants out as early as possible.

Quetzal + E3 Feedback Implants = break any barrier in the game no matter the strength.

Knight + E3 Feedback Implants = cost effective anything breaker (minus AI).

Overmind + E3 Feedback Implants = another cost effective ice breaker that cost one counter per ice instead of one counter per subroutine. Throw in Deep Red and now you have 5 counters to break ice with.

Still being tested: Femme Fatale to break through ice that would hurt my AI suite of breakers. Also used to bypass an expensive ice at Tollbooth.

The one of cards (stimhack, retrieval run, vamp, and demo run) are creating some inconsistencies in the deck. Need to perform more testing to determine which way to go.

Considering switching to at least one more stimhack for a nasty suprise attack when you are low on credits.

name: The Misery Factory
description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: I'm currently testing this with unreleased cards. The Commercializations are actually Merlins. The Eden Fragment is a Hades Fragment.

Decklist provided for a friend who wants to try it after I spanked him so bad he scooped after 10 minutes of frustration and pain.

name: Switchblade Sisters
description:
Andromeda has hit the streets, and she's ready to live it up! Unless you're a friend or business associate, you need to stay the hell outta her way! Her weapon of choice has recently been a Switchblade, and don't be fooled by the red dress or charming good looks. She is not afraid to use it.

Andi has been around the block more than a few times, and has just the connections she needs to make everything she does as painless as possible. Her fellow PICs include the elusive Kati Jones and the ruthless Femme Fatales. Everything she does packs a punch...

But don't go and think that she can't Sneak in through the back door if need be!

Bad girls need publicity - tell me what ya think of her!

name: Weyland
Domestic Counterstrike
description:
Runner needs to steal 9 points to win, you need 6 + Domestic Sleepers. I threw in Punitive Counterstrike for good measure and synergy. The rest of the deck kind of stated to build itself after these major strategic choices.. :)

Untested as of 16/10/2014

name: Sympathetic Junkie  Ver: 0.2
description:
Abuse Stimhack to get your rig of 2 x Femme Fatale, 1 x Torch and 1 x Snowball out. Scavenge Femme Fatale or Snowball to Dinosaurus, when you eventually draw it.

Public Sympathy is there to ease the pain of Stimhacking and helps to keep those multi-access cards in hand.

Ver: 0.1 desperately needed cheaper breaker options. Here's some. I really don't like removing Test Run and The Maker's Eye, but.. money was a bit tight in my games. Maybe I just need to dumb those Prepaid VoicePADs..

name: Don't Be That Guy
description:
Duggar for ten cards, Mass Install/Autoscript/Beckman your viruses all in one go. Pop Hades when you've got an open shot at the Archives. Deja Vu it back if you want, otherwise keep those Caches coming back out. Don't run unless you're certain of success and safety.

If you're a real bastard, add Joshua B to the mix. He's a moving part that can make the whole things go sideways if you're forgetful, but he's also the nitrous on top of this mess.

Firing Hades: You will probably get a third of R&D into Archives, recursion not withstanding. If you get to 10 or more without Jax molesting your chances, go ahead and use Hades. Even if it fails to steal an agenda, you will have at least one Deja by this point ready to go. Also, the smaller the agendas, the larger you should let R&D get. There will be more, and it will be harder for the Corp to shepherd them all back to safety.

Viruses: Cache-Deja-Cache. Imp and Hemo for naked server decks, otherwise they're grist for the mill. Use Parasite and Sucker to keep a path to Archives open, and run only sparingly. Lamprey is just cheap meat for Aesop, while Scheherazade might get you a little bit of cash.

name: i know what you did last cycle
description:
Designed to mess with the runners deck. Sniff around their stack and trash econ, look in their hand with snoop and kill those nasty surprises.

Plenty of asset economy, all expensive to trash to keep the runner poor, lock it in with encryption protocols.

City surveillance for tags, and once they slip, big brother... And then the tags will just keep rising...

Thoughts suggestions?

name: Andromeda Supplier
Up and Down

description: This might be a janky deck. Focus is on tagging and killing

name: Professional Infection
description: Virus deck with Professional Contacts as main engine to draw your cheap virus and to collect some credits to play them: with ProCo and 1-2 Cyberfeeders you're able to play 1-2 viruses per turn. The draw engine is a bit more click intensive than Wyldside, but you have more flexibility because you can choose when you want to activate the ability (for example you are free to play Deja vu to recover 2 viruses, install them and run in a single turn). You can also use all your clicks to draw/gain credits to easily recover from damages or bankrupt; in addition Professional Contacts made you less dependent from Aesop (still very good, but you can wait the mid-late game to play it). I think is a good alternative to Wyldside which I often feel uncomfortable to play.

name: Who Let The Dogs Out?? v2
description: Beware. Angry Dogs.

name: The Misery Factory V.2
description: Decklist provided for a friend who wants to try it after I spanked him so bad he scooped after 10 minutes of frustration and pain. Now updated with the right cards!

name: Switchblade Sisters - Act 2
description:
Andromeda has hit the streets, and she's ready to live it up! Unless you're a friend or business associate, you need to stay the hell outta her way! Her weapon of choice has recently been a Switchblade, and don't be fooled by the red dress or charming good looks. She is not afraid to use it.

Andi has been around the block more than a few times, and has just the connections she needs to make everything she does as painless as possible. Her fellow PICs include the elusive Kati Jones and the ruthless Femme Fatales. Everything she does packs a punch...

But don't go and think that she can't Cloak her true intentions if need be!

Bad girls crave publicity - tell me what ya think of her!

name: Nasir Artic Ops
description: looking for feedback

name: Same Old Street Chess
description:
Derivative of an attempt to make Freelance Coding Construct work with street chess. Dropped FCC in favor of a sparser program setup and a Same Old Thing powered event economy.

Pros: Lots of mini-combos and answers to common ICE types. Street chess engine really helps fire up the mid game.

Cons: Prone to tags, traces, and flatlines. Iffy consistency. Engine can stall early game unless you're very lucky/clever with click order and program tutoring.

name: Praise the Sun!
Can I Play With Madness?
description:
So the runner just spent his last click and you rezzed Chairman Hiro. Best case scenario it's Ronin + Neural EMP for the win.

But let's say the bastard decided to run your unrezzed and unadvanced (if you didn't Mushin him for the bluff) Boss instead. Then you better have him protected behind Inazuma + Kitsune. Chances are great you'll be able to present the invader with a Fetal AI, dealing 3 net damage and costing $2 (if stolen) or a Snare!, dealing 3 and a tag. Well, the son of a bitch kept on running. That's OK, let him pay $6 (please, no IMPs) and take another net damage. Those are some expensive 2 points IMO. I'm not even considering the House of Knives counters or the killing traps the runner might fall into.

The felon probably holds less than 4 cards now. The combinations are many. Ronin + Scorched Earth, Scorched Earth + Neural EMP, Ronin + Ronin, and so it goes.

Hiro is dangerous for both players but he also costs the runner 6 creds and a net. That's more than NAPD Contract if stolen from centrals. But once installed he can mean victory. This deck is insane and needs further testing, so obviously suggestions are welcome.

name: D4V-Man
description:
The rig idea is to run Atman at 4 3 & 2 allowing D4V1D and the regular breakers to deal with the rest. making the breaking super cheap though some set-up will be required.

Using the rabbit hole and trade-in to get my hardware as i need it after finding alot of spare influence i decided to take a second D4V1D.

name: Wake up in a dumpster v2.1
description:
That's what happens when you spend All Night at Duggar's

It appears that Duggar's got a little too crowded....there is a lot more nasty things in its dumpster right now.

I'm testing this version of my thematic deck and its a little more aggressive, consistent and harder to play. There is answer to a lot of things now. I'm all ears for tips and feedback.

name: Stimhack Simpathy
description:
I played this deck for around 6 months. I think it had at least an 80% win rate.

It is now less strong with Will-o-the-Whisp + Shutdown in the meta; though I believe one could fix this weakness with some tweaking (maybe adding a paintbrush or something).

Depending on the meta, I would increase/decrease number of Plascretes and R&D Interface.

It is crazy fast in getting credits and breakers. Basically try to get the Pro Co early (first two or three turns), and the game is pretty much done.

Same old thing was exclusively reserved for Stimhacks and LevyAR; and for Quality Time when running with 2 or 3 Interfaces against heavy net damage Jinteki's RnD or whatnot.

name: Jinteki Killer
description: Insidious Jinteki. I've lost against this deck repeatedly. Any suggestions on how to beat it very welcome.

name: Dumpsters Full of Gold
description:
Derived from Diegofsv's extremely awesome and thematic Walking Up in a Dumpster (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/9602/wake-up-in-a-dumpster)

I dropped Monolith for Leprechauns and added some R&D Interfaces. I use Test Run -> Scavenge from the Heap to pay for huge breakers and draw a card from Exile's ability.

Then I Magnum Opus for money and run with Clone Chip up so I can grab a Sharpshooter or Deus Ex as needed.

R&D Interfaces help build up for a lock if you can't plow through a remote.

Still starts slow, but when it starts rolling, there's no stopping the dumpster train as you dig for Agenda gold.

You can also Scavenge onto Leprechaun to solve memory issues, Femme target changes or other shinanigans.

name: Binge and Purge
description:
Step 1: Binge - Get your ridiculous card draw and hand size machine running.

Step 1.5: Regret - Regret the decisions you've made that have brought to the point of having a 20 card hand size and no way to pay for anything you have.

Step 2: Purge - Install all the viruses. Mill the shit of the corp. Don't even run. Not worth your clicks.

Rinse and repeat until the corp has no more cards to pull.

With 23 virus cards in your deck, you should be able to mill enough cards to deck most corps.

name: Taxing Together
description:
Standard Red Coats feel with the Stronger Together bioroid tax. I haven't tested it yet, but my EtF taxing deck suffered from Caduceus and Viper being crippled by link. I kept Viper, but Stronger Together puts Viktor 1.0 and Eli 1.0 into a very irritating taxing bracket, once the bioroids start doubling up.

Doubling up of course being a requirement in order to make the ICE firm up and keep the runner out. To that end, Jackson Howard and a generally smaller agenda pool work together to keep the agendas safe in HQ or Archives while I build up the ICE fortress. R&D seems like it will be the biggest weakness, so priority should go there.

Any advice? My understanding is that Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together is really hard to make work well, but I'd like to give it a try. An obvious add would be Enhanced Login Protocol, but I don't have that pack yet. Also looking for better ways to add econ.
